dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, B, you caught that report this week about the Pentagon and, uh, Trump's golf resort in Scotland?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, B, you caught that report this week about the Pentagon and, uh, Trump's golf resort in Scotland?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! I mean, the numbers are just wild. Like, at least $184,000, right? If not more, at Turnberry since he took office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! I mean, the numbers are just wild. Like, at least one hundred eighty four thousand dollars, right? If not more, at Turnberry since he took office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pentagon has spent at least $184,000if not moreat President Trumps Scottish resort since he took office, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And that's the thing, right? The House Oversight Committee has been, like, digging into this because Democrats are basically saying, "Hey, is the President potentially profiting from, you know, military spending?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And that's the thing, right? The House Oversight Committee has been, like, digging into this because Democrats are basically saying, Hey, is the President potentially profiting from, you know, military spending?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given that Trumps family owns the resort, Democrats have criticized the number of military personnel passing through there, amid claims that Trump could potentially be profiting from spending by the Pentagon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's that whole emoluments thing again, isn't it? [interrupts] I mean, it all started with these Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's that whole emoluments thing again, isn't it? I mean, it all started with these Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The House Oversight and Reform Committee had originally asked in June about a surge in Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport in Scotland.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, exactly. And instead of staying near the airport, these crews were put up, like, 30 miles away at his resort, Trump Turnberry.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, exactly. And instead of staying near the airport, these crews were put up, like, thirty miles away at his resort, Trump Turnberry.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Various crews have been put up 30 miles away, at Trump Turnberry, during overnight stopovers, Politico first reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, the Defense Department records show nearly $125,000 just on rooms since August 2017. At, like, an average of 189 bucks a night. That's a lot of rooms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, the Defense Department records show nearly one hundred twenty five thousand dollars just on rooms since August twenty seventeen. At, like, an average of one hundred eighty nine bucks a night. That's a lot of rooms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017. At an average cost of $189 per night, that would suggest a total of 660 individual rooms paid for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. That's, what, like 660 individual rooms? And then there's *another* sixty grand they couldn't even tie to travel vouchers. They're guessing it was, like, meals and stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. That's, what, like six hundred sixty individual rooms? And then there's another sixty grand they couldn't even tie to travel vouchers. They're guessing it was, like, meals and stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At an average cost of $189 per night, that would suggest a total of 660 individual rooms paid for. There was also about $60,000 spent at the resort that could not be tied to actual travel vouchers, with the Pentagons letter suggesting that it could have been used on meals and restaurants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm, yeah. So basically, just a huge bill being paid out to his own property. And the committee, they're frustrated, right? Because the Pentagon's response was, like, pretty limited in detail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm, yeah. So basically, just a huge bill being paid out to his own property. And the committee, they're frustrated, right? Because the Pentagon's response was, like, pretty limited in detail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they said it was 'far more taxpayer funds... than previously known.' Which, um, you know, isn't exactly a ringing endorsement of transparency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they said it was far more taxpayer funds... than previously known. Which, um, you know, isn't exactly a ringing endorsement of transparency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all. And it's not the first time this has happened, either. I mean, we've seen this pattern with, like, political organizations and even his own campaign spending at his properties.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all. And it's not the first time this has happened, either. I mean, we've seen this pattern with, like, political organizations and even his own campaign spending at his properties.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since he took office, spending at Trump properties by political candidates or organizations, including Trumps own campaign, has surged.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. The D.C. hotel, remember? That became, like, *the* hotspot for lobbyists and foreign officials trying to, you know, cozy up to the administration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. The D C hotel, remember? That became, like, the hotspot for lobbyists and foreign officials trying to, you know, cozy up to the administration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump hotel in Washington D.C., for instance, has become a hotspot for various lobbyists and political figures hoping to garner favor with the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like hundreds of members of Congress, administration officials, and over a hundred foreign officials from, like, 60 different countries spotted at his various properties. It's, uh, a pretty clear conflict of interest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like hundreds of members of Congress, administration officials, and over a hundred foreign officials from, like, sixty different countries spotted at his various properties. It's, uh, a pretty clear conflict of interest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last two years alone, at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials and over 110 foreign officials from nearly 60 different countries have been seen at different Trump properties, according to a count by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. It just keeps highlighting how he routinely mixed his official duties with his own commercial interests while in office. It's a pattern, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. It just keeps highlighting how he routinely mixed his official duties with his own commercial interests while in office. It's a pattern, for sure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has almost routinely mixed his official duties and commercial interests while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And now we're seeing the receipts, literally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And now we're seeing the receipts, literally.
